member.name: M:Telerik.Sitefinity.Model.IDatabaseMappingContext.GetMapping(System.String,System.Type,Telerik.Sitefinity.Model.DatabaseColumnMapping)
member.summary: Returns the correct column mapping for the specific database backend.
member.param: The CLR type to be used as a fallback when is null or empty.
Intended mapping details, like length, precision, etc.
member.returns: A column mapping for the specific database backend.
member.remarks: The initial datails may be removed or overriden, if the backend does not support them.

member.name: M:Telerik.Sitefinity.Model.IDatabaseMappingContext.GetTextMapping(System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Nullable{System.Int32})
member.summary: Returns the correct character column mapping for the specific database backend.
member.param: Whether the column is a long text, e.g. (N)TEXT, (N)VARCHAR(MAX), etc.
Whether the column should support Unicode.

The required length, which if not supported, is modified to one that is. It can even be reset to null (e.g. not supported length for NVARCHAR, converted to NTEXT), in which case any subsequent calls to should be avoided.
member.returns: A column mapping for the specific database backend.
member.remarks: The initial datails may be removed or overriden, if the backend does not support them.

member.name: M:Telerik.Sitefinity.Model.IDatabaseMappingContext.GetBinaryMapping(System.Boolean,System.Nullable{System.Int32})
member.summary: Returns the correct binary column mapping for the specific database backend.
member.param: Whether the column is long binary/blob, e.g. VARBINARY(MAX).

The required length, which if not supported, is modified to one that is. It can even be reset to null (e.g. not supported length for VARBINARY, converted to IMAGE), in which case any subsequent calls to should be avoided.
member.returns: A column mapping for the specific database backend.
member.remarks: The initial datails may be removed or overriden, if the backend does not support them.

member.name: M:Telerik.Sitefinity.Model.IDatabaseMappingContext.GetBooleanMapping(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Returns the correct Boolean column mapping for the specific database backend.
member.param: Whether to use some small integer type, instead of BIT, e.g. TINYINT.
member.returns: A column mapping for the specific database backend.
member.remarks: The initial datails may be removed or overriden, if the backend does not support them.

member.remarks: The initial datails may be removed or overriden, if the backend does not support them.

member.summary: This method is used as a workaround for setting the id on the objects generated through deserialization process.
member.remarks: It is not possible to call constructors when deserializing an object; yet we cannot implement the setter of the Id property as it will not be compatible with Telerik OpenAcces (identity cannot be changed after the object has been added to the scope). member.summary: Gets or sets the ID of the user that last edited the item

Holds ID of a user. Who this user is depends on the CLC status of the content item.
Live ID of the last user that published the item
Master ID of the last user that checked-in the item
Temp This property has no meaning if we are in this status.

member.name: M:Telerik.Sitefinity.Pages.Model.ObjectData.GetProperties(System.Globalization.CultureInfo,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Returns the properties of the object for the given language. If the null is specified for language, the invariant language properties are returned. To add properties to the object you must use the Properties property. Note: this method has logic to always return required properties - those are properties that should always be present (like ID). If not found in the given language, they are returned(cloned) from another(random) language. Those properties should have the same value for all languages, so it doesn't really matter.

member.name: M:Telerik.Sitefinity.Pages.Model.ObjectData.GetPropertiesRaw(System.Globalization.CultureInfo)
member.summary: Returns the properties of the object in the specified language. Note, that this method does not handle any additional business logic. It only filters the properties for the language from all the properties. If you need the business logic handled (fallback, required properties, etc.) you need to call GetProperties(CultureInfo) method.

member.name: M:Telerik.Sitefinity.Pages.Model.ObjectData.GetPropertiesRaw(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the properties of the object in the specified language. Note, that this method does not handle any additional business logic. It only filters the properties for the language from all the properties. If you need the business logic handled (fallback, required properties, etc.) you need to call GetProperties(CultureInfo) method.
member.param: The language to get properties for. This must be the Name property of the CultureInfo object or NULL to return invariant language properties.

member.name: T:Telerik.Sitefinity.Metadata.Model.PropertyStorageType
member.summary: Describes how the value of the field is stored in the database. Normal - Stored in the database Calculated – Calculated upon update of the content and the value is stored in the database – example TotalAmount = Price * Quantity Computed - Not stored in the database and does not have database column. It is calculated every time on demand (or cached). Usefull in scenarios with very dinamicly changed data. ReadOnly - The field cannot be changed using the user interface. It can be changed through API (code) only.

member.name: F:Telerik.Sitefinity.Metadata.Model.PropertyStorageType.Normal
member.summary: Stored in the database

member.name: F:Telerik.Sitefinity.Metadata.Model.PropertyStorageType.Calculated
member.summary: Calculated upon update of the content and the value is stored in the database – example TotalAmount = Price * Quantity

member.name: F:Telerik.Sitefinity.Metadata.Model.PropertyStorageType.Computed
member.summary: Not stored in the database and does not have database column. It is calculated every time on demand (or cached). Usefull in scenarios with very dinamicly changed data.

member.name: F:Telerik.Sitefinity.Metadata.Model.PropertyStorageType.ReadOnly
member.summary: The field cannot be changed using the user interface. It can be changed through API (code) only.

member.name: T:Telerik.Sitefinity.Publishing.Model.PipeInvokationMode
member.summary: Controls the automatic triggering of pipes

member.name: F:Telerik.Sitefinity.Publishing.Model.PipeInvokationMode.Pull
member.summary:
For inbound pipes Pull means the pipe will pull external data into the publishing point on a scheduled basis or upon demand from a user, it is triggered from the publishing system, not triggered from external event a good example is POP3 mail pulling of data
For outbound pipes like RSS feeds, it means data is pulled from the publishing point upon demand from external system

member.name: F:Telerik.Sitefinity.Publishing.Model.PipeInvokationMode.Push
member.summary:
For inbound pipes Push means the pipe is called upon some system event it is subscribed for,e.g. the change in external data automatically initiates the update in the publishing point - for example upon publishing a BlogPost
For outbound pipes Push means the pipe is called once on each update in the publishing point with the specific data to be published example: push to tweeter , push to facebook etc. happens only once upon the event of change in the publishing point

member.name: M:Telerik.Sitefinity.Descriptors.LstringPropertyDescriptor.GetAvailableLanguages(System.Object,System.Boolean,System.Globalization.CultureInfo)
member.summary: Gets the available languages for the specified object.
member.param: The object to get available languages for.
if set to true the invariant value will be considered as value for the default frontend and backend languages if their values do not exist.

The default language for the specified object. This language will be considered "available" even if its value is null if a value for the invariant language exists. This should be either the default frontend language for frontend objects or the default backend language for backend objects. If this parameter is null, both frontend and backend default languages will be used.

member.summary: This method gets the average of the two ordinal values and starts rounding it with more precision each time until a value that is between the previousOrdinal and the nextOrdinal is reached or until the last rounded value is equal to the previous rounded value (the max precision of the floating point is reached).

member.name: P:Telerik.Sitefinity.Pages.Model.PageData.IsAutoCreated
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether this page is created automatically by the system in order to preserve consistent structure. Pages are created automatically when a SPLIT page is created - a PageNode + PageData is automatically created for each available language.
member.value: true if this instance is auto created; otherwise, false.

member.summary: Creates a relation between users and data items

In our example, the name could be "ContentRated", the DataItemId would be the id of the content that is rated, Context would be empty and the Data - vote

member.name: T:Telerik.Sitefinity.Model.WcfItemBase
member.summary:
Marker interface for replaceable wcf items.
This class was moved the WcfItemBase class from Telerik.Sitefinity to Telerik.Sitefinity.Model This is in order for it to be available for model classes, such as content-derived classes, users, roles etc. It's impossible to use WcfItemBase in Telerik.Sitefinity.Model while it's defined in Telerik.Sitefinity, because Telerik.Sitefinity.Model does not contain a reference to Telerik.Sitefinity. It's also impossible to add a reference to Telerik.Sitefinity in Telerik.Sitefinity.Model, because it would cause a circular dependency (Telerik.Sitefinity has a reference to Telerik.Sitefinity.Model, as it should). Hence, it's better for it to reside in Telerik.Sitefinity.Model.

remarks.para: Items, implementing this type, are typically prefixed with "Wcf".
Note that it is required for them to have a constructor that accepts the data item that is used in queries.

member.name: P:Telerik.Sitefinity.Web.Model.QueryItem.ItemPath
member.summary: Gets or sets the item path. The item path is used to preserve information about where in the expression hierarchy the corresponding query item is. The item path is constructed by the ordinals of the items on the path between the root item and the current one, separated by underscores. Example: "_0_2_1". This item path is used on the client for constructing the UI of the query builder control.
